central_thesis: The word 'Zorabia' is presented as a uniquely potent word of power, revealed by the spirit Mammon, which unifies the essence of the Four Princes of Hell, contains specific 'numbers of the beast' through Hebraic numerology, and serves as the supreme invocation within the Torelian system of Magickal practice to achieve results like 'wealth beyond wealth'.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Revelation and Nature of Zorabia
structure_content.summary: This text introduces 'Zorabia' as a powerful magical word. The author, Rev. F. Nagash, recounts receiving this word directly from Mammon during a rite aimed at acquiring 'wealth beyond wealth'. He explains that Zorabia encapsulates the combined numbers of the 'Four Crowned Ones' and numerically integrates the 'names of the Four Princes of Hell as one'. Furthermore, through Hebraic numerology, Zorabia is shown to contain the specific 'numbers of the beast' (1-3-6-9). This makes it the paramount word of power in the Torelian system of Magickal practice, intended for direct and potent ritual application as an alternative to conventional infernal invocations.

key_concepts.definition: A potent word of power revealed by Mammon, stated to encompass 'all of the numbers of the Four Crowned Ones' and to represent 'the names of the Four Princes of Hell as one'. Through the Hebraic numerological system, it contains 'all four numbers of the beast within it: 1-3-6-9'. It is established as the 'supreme word of power now in the Torelian system of Magickal practice' for direct use in ritual.

Entities whose 'numbers' are encompassed by Zorabia. In the context of Zorabia representing 'Princes of Hell', these are understood as powerful infernal or spiritual entities, rather than the Christian martyrs of the same name.
A spirit or demon associated with material wealth and greed, who 'confessed his presence' to the author and revealed the word Zorabia in response to a request for 'wealth beyond wealth'.
A traditional Qabalistic 'word of power consisting of all the names of god in one word'. It is presented as the direct 'opposite' of Zorabia, highlighting Zorabia's infernal nature.
Specific infernal entities whose individual names are implicitly unified or represented as 'one' within the word Zorabia, thereby concentrating their collective power.
The interpretive method used by the author to discover that Zorabia contains specific numerical values, particularly 'all four numbers of the beast within it: 1-3-6-9'.

Specific numerical values (1, 3, 6, 9) identified by the author through Hebraic numerology as being contained within Zorabia, associating it with infernal or anti-divine forces, distinct from the commonly recognized 666.

A specific, implied magical tradition or framework within which Zorabia is now elevated to the status of the 'supreme word of power', suggesting a structured practice where this word holds a central role.

practical_system.description: The practical system presented centers on the direct and exclusive use of 'Zorabia' as the supreme word of power in Magickal practice. The word is intended to serve as a singular, potent invocation that channels the combined energies of the Four Princes of Hell and the numerologically embedded 'numbers of the beast'. This replaces more traditional or elaborate infernal invocations, aiming for a direct and concentrated effect. Its primary application, as suggested by its revelation by Mammon, is for 'wealth beyond wealth', though its 'supreme word of power' status in the Torelian system implies broader applications.
rituals: Utilization of 'Zorabia' in ritual settings as the central, ultimate word of power to invoke infernal entities or energies.
Specific rites focused on the acquisition of 'wealth beyond wealth' by vibrating or speaking 'Zorabia'.

relevant_quotes.text: Zorabia is a word, which encompasses all of the numbers of the Four Crowned Ones.
While performing a rite about 6 months ago, Mammon confessed his presence, I asked for wealth beyond wealth. Instead he gave me a word!
It is like saying just the opposite of Shemhamforash (A word of power consisting of all he names of god in one word where as Zorabia is the names of the Four Princes of Hell as one).
Through the Hebraic numerological system, I found it has all four numbers of the beast within it: 1-3-6-9, and is used as the supreme word of power now in the Torelian system of Magickal practice!
Rather then ramble on Hail Satan, Hail Lucifer etc. Just Zorabia.

critical_analysis.relevance: This text introduces a concise, powerful, and purportedly divinely revealed word of power ('Zorabia') into the landscape of modern Left-Hand Path and infernal magic. Its significance lies in its attempt to simplify and intensify magical invocation by consolidating multiple infernal associations (Four Crowned Ones, Four Princes of Hell, numbers of the beast) into a single, potent utterance. By explicitly positioning Zorabia as the 'opposite of Shemhamforash', the author clearly delineates its infernal allegiance and provides a symbolic counterpoint to traditional Abrahamic Qabalah. The text suggests a pragmatic approach to magic, prioritizing direct energetic access over verbose ritual, and integrating both spiritual revelation (from Mammon) and esoteric analysis (Hebraic numerology) to validate its efficacy. This approach aligns with elements found in modern Chaos Magic or results-oriented ceremonial magic, where efficacy and streamlined practice are often valued.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience for this text includes practitioners of Western Esotericism, particularly those involved in Demonolatry, Infernal Magic, Left-Hand Path traditions, or pragmatic ceremonial magic. It would appeal to magicians seeking new or streamlined words of power, those interested in the 'Torelian system of Magickal practice', or occultists exploring methods for manifesting 'wealth beyond wealth' through infernal currents. Its technical references to Hebraic numerology and comparison to Shemhamforash imply a readership with at least a foundational understanding of esoteric terminology.
